1. Shear stress is caused by forces acting in
() Angular direction () Transverse direction () Perpendicular direction (x) Parallel opposite direction
2. Modulus of rigidity is found by shear test.( Say True of False)
(x) False () True
3. To obtain double shear in N/mm^2 given failure load (P) in kg, area of c/s( A)in mm^2 , which equation is correct
() P / (4 * A) (x) P / (2 * A) () (2 * P) / A () (P / A)
4. Which statement is correct
1) Shear stress is caused by forces which act perpendicular to area of c/s. 2) If there is one c/s which resist failure, the material is said to be in single shear. 3) Ultimate strength in double shear will be equal to minimum load divided by twice area of c/s.
() 1 is correct () 1 is correct () 2 and 3 is correct (x) 2 is correct
5. For which material Poisons ratio is more than unity.
() Copper () Aluminium () Steel (x) None of the above
